ns2:li: Alerts designated organizational officials in the event of an audit processing failure; and

ns2:li.ns2:em: Assignment: organization-defined actions to be taken (e.g., shut down information system, overwrite oldest audit records, stop generating audit records)

ns2:p.#text: Audit processing failures include, for example, software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded. Related control: AU-4.
The information system provides a warning when allocated audit record storage volume reaches [] of maximum audit record storage capacity.

ns2:p.ns2:em: Assignment: organization-defined audit failure events requiring real-time alerts
ns2:p.#text: The information system provides a real-time alert when the following audit failure events occur: [].
The information system enforces configurable traffic volume thresholds representing auditing capacity for network traffic and [] network traffic above those thresholds.
The information system invokes a system shutdown in the event of an audit failure, unless an alternative audit capability exists.
